rComments: Boring lectures (lots of sidebars of topic).  He seems to like the sound of his own voice and comes across as pompous. When teaching religion, his personal views shouldn't be pushed on students. Also, needs to be more respectful of other's religion. ie: what might be "silly rituals" to him, he should know, they may be sacred to others to not offend

I had difficulty with him when I first started but after 4 years I've figured out how he thinks and grades papers. I really enjoyed his lectures and wished they were 4 hours! Lol. He is also very gracious when he marks exam papers. Was expecting a 55 and got an 88 on the exam!

Honestly the worst class I ever took, glad its over. Prof was not willing to give proper feedback and assumed that students should know everything ahead of time. Not everyone comes from the same place and he was more inclined to complain about this then actually help clear things up for people in the course.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Tough grader', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: He is amazing professor. Love the lectures. Also helps that he is so cute

It was an interesting course to say the least, at first I was unsure of how to complete the weekly ECQ's but after the third week I guess you could say I got the hang of it, from getting 1/3 on the first to to then getting 2/3's and even a couple of 2.5/3's later on. Assignments overall were fair, but it was difficult to know what was expected of.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Tough grader', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: He's a great Prof. Super engaging even with an online class. Lectures are interesting and made me want to learn more. Readings are a must to pass the class and assignments are tedious but overall really enjoyed the class.

He was probably the best professor I've had in my time at UTM so far. His teaching methods are amazing especially since he "gets" this generation. His lectures are very straight forward and as for assignments, he tells you exactly what he wants to see. Follow his instructions directly and you will do well!!
Amazing professor and highly recommended for anyone in the study of religion!

The workload was immense and I feel like he changed his marking criteria half way through the course. I didn't know what he wanted from us in the essays and ecq's until the course was almost over - i learned my final lesson when the class was indeed over.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Lots of homework']

rComments: What an amazing professor. I learned so much from him. Oh and he's super HOT!
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Lots of homework', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: RLG203 was very different than what I expected. Smith's lectures are interesting and I learned a lot! He's witty and makes the material easy to understand. Beware of the ECQ and don't leave them until the last minute. I suggest asking for a clear outline so you know what to expect. Assignments and exam were both easy if you put in some effort.

He is the best prof I ever had!! His teaching method is by far amazing compare to every other prof. He explains everything in full detail, he is very clear, organized, helpful and sweetest man ever. Easy marker. Look forward to any classes with him. He is the reason why i want to become a prof. Recommend on taking his classes. Love him!
The Class was EASY!!!! I wish all UTM courses were like this.

Professor Smith is an excellent professor! He taught me intro to Christianity and although he is not a Christian himself, he was very respectful and informative. His lectures were VERY interesting and he is a great speaker. He's also extremely hot, so if you want something nice to look at while you learn, take one of his classes.

The perfect teacher/professor. He should really give a class on how you treat students that other professors should attend. Must take a class with him. Very clear, passionate, informative and fun. HIGHLY recommended. Come to class and you'll be fine. Expand your minds with Dr. Smith.

He is the best professor I have ever had so far! He is so clear when explaining, his discussions in class are so broad, open minded and interesting. Even the assignments are pretty far. Taking 203 with prof Smith was the best decision :) and he is HOT too ;)
He is engaging to the new generation. Teachers like him are needed, he makes the course exciting and engaging from the beginning to the end.
Pretty awesome teacher! I would love to have him again if I was a Religion major
